    public class ShowPhotoActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
implements PhotoCacheDataSource.OnPhotoCacheArrivedListener
    ShowPhotoActivity is the activity that show the full photo with details.

    • Field Detail

      • localPhotosUtil

        private final LocalPhotosDataSource localPhotosUtil
        Singleton instance that hold a list of the names (ids) of the local (downloaded) photos so, when we download a photo we add here name (id) to this list, so all the app can be synchronized.

      • maxSize

        private static final int maxSize
        The max size num of the photos that we keep cached in the memory.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • fullPhotosCaching

        private static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,PhotoCache> fullPhotosCaching
        Map that hold the ids of the photos as a keys, and the cached photos as a values. we define the max size of this map to be 32. to get good experience and NOT to fill the ram. Notice: that this map is synchronized map and her type is OptimizedMap, our customized map.

      • loadPhotoCache

        private void loadPhotoCache(java.lang.String photoId,
                            java.lang.String thumbPhotoLink)
        Load the cached photo into the ImageView, and if NO cached photo, then set the thump photo into ImageView , and go to the internet and cache the photo.
        Parameters:
        photoId - is the id (name) of the photo that we want to show the user.
        thumbPhotoLink - is the link of the thump photo, so we can show the thump photo, while loading and cache the full photo.

      • setUI

        private void setUI(PhotoCache photoCache)
        This method is responsible to set all the UI to the user, after we sure that we have the cached photo.
        Parameters:
        photoCache - is an instance that hold all the info of the cached photo so we can display it to the user.

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        Description copied from class: android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        Dispatch onResume() to fragments. Note that for better inter-operation with older versions of the platform, at the point of this call the fragments attached to the activity are not resumed. This means that in some cases the previous state may still be saved, not allowing fragment transactions that modify the state. To correctly interact with fragments in their proper state, you should instead override FragmentActivity.onResumeFragments().
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

      • onPause

      • onResult

        public void onResult(@NonNull
                     PhotoCache photoCache)
        Called only if the photo is NOT cached, first we called getPhotoCache after the photo is arrived this method will called to set the UI. this method is defined in OnPhotoCacheArrivedListener when this (ShowPhotoActivity) is implement OnPhotoCacheArrivedListener.
        Specified by:
        onResult in interface PhotoCacheDataSource.OnPhotoCacheArrivedListener
        Parameters:
        photoCache - photoCache is an instance that hold all the info of the cached photo so we can display it to the user.

      • onError

        public void onError(@NonNull
                    java.lang.Exception e)
        Called if something wrong happen (Exception trowed) while caching the photo. So here we show the user, the reason of the Exception.
        Specified by:
        onError in interface PhotoCacheDataSource.OnPhotoCacheArrivedListener
        Parameters:
        e - is exception that trowed while caching the photo.
